pathway.weightDescription: For accurate dose calculations (can skip if unknown)
pathway.weightCanBeSetLater: Weight can be set or changed anytime during CPR

weight.title: Patient Weight
weight.description: Enter patient weight for dose calculations
weight.optionalHint: Optional - can be set during CPR

rhythm.selectInitial: Select initial rhythm to begin protocol

rhythmCheckModal.title: RHYTHM CHECK
rhythmCheckModal.subtitle: Pause CPR briefly. Analyze rhythm. Check pulse.

hsTs.title: H's & T's - Reversible Causes
hsTs.hypovolemiaDiagnostic: Look for hemorrhage/volume loss clues; check Hb/Hct and ABG/VBG (including lactate) if available. Use POCUS (IVC/ventricular size) and FAST in trauma/suspected bleeding.
hsTs.hypovolemiaManagement: Control bleeding (e.g., tourniquet/pelvic binder when appropriate) and start rapid volume replacement - blood products when hemorrhage is likely, otherwise IV fluids.
hsTs.hypoxiaDiagnostic: Use waveform capnography, SpO‚ÇÇ trend, and ventilatory mechanics; obtain ABG/VBG if feasible without delaying critical actions.
hsTs.hypoxiaManagement: Fix oxygenation/ventilation immediately - optimize BVM, clear obstruction, secure advanced airway when needed, and deliver high-concentration oxygen with appropriate ventilation rate.
hsTs.hydrogenIonDiagnostic: ABG/VBG for pH/lactate and context (e.g., prolonged downtime, poor ventilation, sepsis, DKA).
hsTs.hydrogenIonManagement: Optimize ventilation and perfusion (avoid hyperventilation; ensure high-quality compressions) and treat the underlying cause; sodium bicarbonate is generally reserved for specific indications per local protocol (commonly including hyperkalemia/TCA overdose).
hsTs.hypoHyperkalemiaDiagnostic: Point-of-care electrolytes (often via blood gas analyzer) plus ECG pattern recognition.
hsTs.hypoHyperkalemiaManagement: If hyperkalemia suspected/confirmed, give IV calcium and shift potassium with insulin/glucose (¬± bicarbonate as adjunct) and arrange definitive removal (e.g., dialysis) when relevant/available. If hypokalemia is the concern, replace potassium after circulation is present/returning (post-ROSC) and correct contributing causes.
hsTs.hypothermiaDiagnostic: Measure core temperature (esophageal probe preferred if intubated) and check ABG/electrolytes to guide complications.
hsTs.hypothermiaManagement: Start active rewarming (warmed fluids/forced-air warming) and consider ECLS/ECMO rewarming pathways for severe hypothermic arrest where available, while continuing standard resuscitation.
hsTs.tensionPneumoDiagnostic: Clinical clues (unilateral breath sounds, high airway pressures, sudden decompensation - especially if ventilated) and lung POCUS (e.g., absent lung sliding).
hsTs.tensionPneumoManagement: Immediate decompression without waiting for imaging (needle decompression) followed by definitive thoracostomy/chest drain ASAP.
hsTs.tamponadeDiagnostic: Cardiac POCUS for pericardial effusion and supportive signs (e.g., plethoric IVC).
hsTs.tamponadeManagement: Emergent pericardiocentesis (POCUS-guided if possible) or resuscitative thoracotomy in select traumatic arrest scenarios.
hsTs.toxinsDiagnostic: Rapid collateral history (medications/exposures), targeted exam, and basic labs (including electrolytes and temperature) to narrow likely toxidromes.
hsTs.toxinsManagement: Supportive care plus targeted antidotes/reversal agents when indicated, with early toxicology/poison-center guidance.
hsTs.thrombosisPulmDiagnostic: Persistently low ETCO‚ÇÇ despite good CPR can support suspicion, and POCUS may show RV strain (¬± DVT scan if it won't prolong pauses).
hsTs.thrombosisPulmManagement: If PE is strongly suspected/known, consider thrombolysis or embolectomy pathways per local capability; prolonged CPR after thrombolysis may be appropriate before termination decisions.
hsTs.thrombosisCoroDiagnostic: Clues include VF/pVT presentation and ischemic prodrome; confirm post-ROSC with 12-lead ECG (e.g., STEMI).
hsTs.thrombosisCoroManagement: After ROSC with STEMI, prioritize urgent coronary angiography/PCI based on system pathways.

pregnancy.title: Pregnancy - Obstetric Arrest
pregnancy.tapToActivate: Tap to activate if pregnant patient
pregnancy.cannotDeactivate: Protocol cannot be deactivated once started
pregnancy.emergencyDeliveryDesc: Resuscitative hysterotomy should ideally be performed by 5 minutes if no ROSC, when fundal height is at or above umbilicus
pregnancy.leftUterineDesc: Use two hands to relieve aortocaval compression and facilitate effective chest compressions
pregnancy.earlyAirwayDesc: Difficult airway is common in pregnancy - use most experienced provider
pregnancy.ivAboveDesc: Place IV access above the diaphragm
pregnancy.stopMagnesiumDesc: If receiving IV magnesium, stop immediately and give calcium
pregnancy.massiveTransfusionDesc: Activate if amniotic fluid embolism suspected
pregnancy.anestheticDiagnostic: Rapid airway/ventilation check; quick POCUS if feasible.
pregnancy.anestheticManagement: Secure airway; if LAST suspected, give lipid emulsion per local protocol.
pregnancy.bleedingDesc: Postpartum hemorrhage, placental abruption, uterine rupture
pregnancy.bleedingDiagnostic: Look for hemorrhage; point-of-care Hb and ABG/VBG.
pregnancy.bleedingManagement: Activate MTP early; OB hemorrhage measures and rapid source control.
pregnancy.cardiovascularDiagnostic: Rhythm analysis; cardiac POCUS; 12-lead ECG after ROSC.
pregnancy.cardiovascularManagement: Defibrillate if indicated; activate cath lab/cardiology pathway post-ROSC when appropriate.
pregnancy.drugsManagement: Stop magnesium and give calcium if magnesium is running.
pregnancy.embolicDiagnostic: Sudden collapse; ETCO‚ÇÇ very low despite good CPR; POCUS RV strain; bleeding/DIC clues for AFE.
pregnancy.feverDiagnostic: Core temp, lactate/ABG, cultures if feasible.
pregnancy.feverManagement: Early broad-spectrum antibiotics and source control post-ROSC.
pregnancy.generalCausesDiagnostic: Targeted H's/T's search with POCUS + ABG/electrolytes/capnography.
pregnancy.hypertensionDiagnostic: Severe-range BP history, seizure, labs post-ROSC (platelets, AST/ALT, creatinine).
pregnancy.hypertensionManagement: Treat severe hypertension per pregnancy protocol; magnesium for eclampsia with toxicity awareness.

history.confirmDeleteMultiple: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} sessions?

settings.voiceDesc: Spoken alerts for epi, rhythm check, pre-charge
settings.defibrillatorDescPALS: Weight-based: 2 J/kg ‚Üí 4 J/kg ‚Üí up to 10 J/kg
settings.themeDesc: Switch between light and dark mode
settings.adultDefibrillatorDesc: Select shock energy for adult patients
settings.epinephrineIntervalDesc: Time between epinephrine doses (AHA recommends 3-5 min)

voice.emergencyDelivery: Emergency delivery. Perform resuscitative hysterotomy now.

banner.startCPRSub: Press the button to begin chest compressions
banner.analyzeRhythmWhenReady: Analyze rhythm when possible - select rhythm below
banner.selectRhythm: Select initial rhythm to begin protocol
banner.rhythmCheckVfPvtSub: If VF/pVT: SHOCK | If not: Select new rhythm | If pulse: ROSC
banner.rhythmCheckGenericSub: Check rhythm and pulse. If VF/pVT: SHOCK | If pulse: ROSC
banner.preChargeSub: Rhythm check in {{seconds}}s - Prepare to analyze rhythm
banner.rhythmCheckNowSub: Tap "Rhythm Check" to pause CPR and analyze

install.title: Install App
install.subtitle: Add ResusBuddy to your home screen for instant access
install.iosNote: Must use Safari browser - Chrome/Firefox won't work on iOS
install.iosStep1Desc: Find the share icon (square with arrow) at the bottom of Safari
install.iosStep2Desc: Scroll down and tap "Add to Home Screen"
install.iosStep3Desc: Tap "Add" in the top right corner
install.androidStep1Desc: Tap the three dots (‚ãÆ) in the top right corner of Chrome
install.androidStep2Desc: Tap "Install app" or "Add to Home screen"
install.benefit1: Works offline - no internet required during codes
install.footer: The app updates automatically when connected to the internet

about.title: Info
about.disclaimerEducational: This app is intended solely for educational and training purposes in simulations
about.disclaimerNotReal: Do not use on real patients - always follow local protocols and clinical judgment
about.disclaimerResponsibility: The user is solely responsible for clinical decisions made during real resuscitations
about.disclaimerNotification: Training Tool Only - Not for real patient use. Always follow local protocols.
about.usageLocalData: All data saved locally on your device only
about.referencesAdult: AHA 2025 Adult Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support Guidelines
about.referencesPediatric: AHA 2025 Pediatric Advanced Life Support Guidelines
about.shareDesc: Share this app with colleagues for training
about.shareText: Check out ResusBuddy - a resuscitation training app!

bradyTachy.bradyAssistBreathing: Assist breathing with PPV as needed
bradyTachy.bradyPacingInstructions: Apply pads (prefer anteroposterior if possible), turn pacing mode on, set an initial rate 60‚Äì80/min in adults (often higher in small children/infants if clinically needed), then increase output current until consistent electrical capture (wide paced QRS with appropriate T waves) and confirm mechanical capture with a palpable pulse/BP (or arterial line/POCUS), then set the mA about 10% above the capture threshold. Give analgesia/sedation if conscious.
bradyTachy.pedsBradyAtropineNote: Atropine: only for increased vagal tone or primary AV block
bradyTachy.pedsBradyAtropineDose: 0.02 mg/kg, repeat once; min 0.1 mg; max single 0.5 mg
bradyTachy.tachyMonitor: Cardiac monitor; monitor BP and oximetry
bradyTachy.tachyIfRegularNarrow: If regular narrow complex, consider adenosine
bradyTachy.tachyCardioversionEnergy: Use device-recommended energy OR maximum energy
bradyTachy.tachyAdenosineDose1: First dose 6 mg rapid IV push + NS flush
bradyTachy.tachyWideAdenosine: Adenosine only if regular AND monomorphic
bradyTachy.tachyProcainamideDose: 20-50 mg/min until suppressed, hypotension, QRS >50%, or max 17 mg/kg
bradyTachy.tachyProcainamideAvoid: Avoid if prolonged QT or CHF
bradyTachy.tachyAmiodaroneDose: 150 mg over 10 min; repeat if VT recurs
bradyTachy.pedsTachySedate: Sedate if possible, but don't delay
bradyTachy.sinusTachyDescription: Probable sinus tachycardia - identify and treat underlying cause (fever, pain, hypovolemia, etc.)
bradyTachy.differentiateRhythmDesc: Differentiate between sinus tachycardia and SVT
bradyTachy.searchCausesDesc: Search for underlying causes: fever, pain, hypovolemia, anxiety, etc.
bradyTachy.checkCriteriaThenSelect: Check the criteria that apply, then select the most likely diagnosis.
bradyTachy.exitSessionWarning: You have an active session. Are you sure you want to exit?
bradyTachy.pedsCompromiseCriteria: Acutely altered mental status, signs of shock, or hypotension
bradyTachy.pedsBradyHR60Instructions: If heart rate <60/min with poor perfusion despite adequate oxygenation and ventilation, start CPR (use red button at top).
bradyTachy.compromisePresentInstruction: If compromise is present (unstable), proceed to immediate cardioversion or adenosine. If no compromise (stable), proceed with vagal maneuvers and adenosine.
bradyTachy.pedsSinusTachyIdentified: Pediatric assessment: Sinus tachycardia - treat underlying cause
bradyTachy.concerningRhythmProceedingToCompromise: Concerning rhythm identified - proceeding to compromise assessment
bradyTachy.enableSyncMode: Ensure defibrillator is in SYNCHRONIZED mode before cardioversion
bradyTachy.recheckSync: Re-check SYNC mode after each cardioversion
bradyTachy.recheckSyncDetail: Some defibrillators lose SYNC mode after shock delivery
bradyTachy.eitherOrInstruction: Use EITHER Calcium Channel Blockers OR Beta-Blockers
bradyTachy.metoprololDose: 2.5-5 mg IV over 2 min (up to 3 doses)

tos.title: Terms of Use
tos.criticalWarning1: This application is NOT affiliated with the American Heart Association (AHA) or any official medical organization
tos.criticalWarning2: This is a training tool - DO NOT USE on real patients
tos.criticalWarning3: Always follow your institution's official protocols and guidelines for actual patient care
tos.backgroundP1: ResusBuddy ("the Application") is an independent, unofficial educational application that provides a digital reference for resuscitation protocols based on publicly available guidelines. This application was created by an independent developer for educational and training simulation purposes only.
tos.backgroundP2: THIS APPLICATION IS NOT AFFILIATED WITH, ENDORSED BY, OR CONNECTED TO THE AMERICAN HEART ASSOCIATION (AHA), ANY HOSPITAL, OR ANY OFFICIAL MEDICAL ORGANIZATION.
tos.backgroundP3: The Application is intended solely for use in educational settings, training simulations, and personal study. It is designed to help healthcare professionals and students practice and familiarize themselves with resuscitation algorithms in a non-clinical environment.
tos.acceptanceP1: By accessing or using ResusBuddy, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Use. If you do not agree to these terms, do not use this Application.
tos.intendedUseP1: This Application is intended EXCLUSIVELY for:
tos.intendedUseWarning: THIS APPLICATION MUST NOT BE USED FOR ACTUAL PATIENT CARE, REAL MEDICAL EMERGENCIES, OR ANY CLINICAL DECISION-MAKING. During real resuscitations, always follow your institution's official protocols, use approved medical devices, and rely on your professional training and judgment.
tos.noMedicalAdviceP1: The content in this Application is for educational reference only and does not constitute medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment recommendations. The information should not be used as a substitute for professional medical training, certification, or clinical judgment.
tos.noMedicalAdviceP2: Healthcare decisions in actual patient care situations must be made by qualified healthcare professionals based on their training, experience, institutional protocols, and individual patient assessment. This Application does not create any physician-patient relationship or healthcare provider relationship.
tos.dataPrivacyP1: ResusBuddy is designed with privacy in mind:
tos.dataPrivacyList1: All data is stored locally on your device only
tos.dataPrivacyList2: No patient data or personal health information should be entered
tos.dataPrivacyList3: No data is transmitted to external servers
tos.dataPrivacyWarning: Do not enter any real patient information, Protected Health Information (PHI), or personally identifiable information into this Application. Any simulated data entered is for training purposes only and is stored locally on your device.
tos.androidP1: If you download this Application on an Android device, you acknowledge that Google Play and Google Inc. are not parties to this Agreement. Google has no obligation to provide maintenance, support, or warranty services for this Application. To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, Google will have no warranty obligation whatsoever with respect to this Application.

Apple has no obligation to furnish any maintenance and support services with respect to the Application. In the event of any failure of the Application to conform to any applicable warranty, Apple will have no other warranty obligation whatsoever with respect to the Application. Apple is not responsible for addressing any claims relating to the Application or your possession and use of the Application.

tos.intellectualPropertyP2: American Heart Association, AHA, ACLS, PALS, and related terms are trademarks of the American Heart Association. This Application is not affiliated with or endorsed by the AHA. Any reference to AHA guidelines is for educational citation purposes only.
